messages.message:
Hi team,
I was facing connection errors in my crafting sandbox (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/prashantkikani?cw=dev), hence file indexing was stuck at 80%.
```level=ERROR time=2025-01-08 04:58:58,449 msg="AMQP connection workflow failed: AMQPConnectionWorkflowFailed: 3 exceptions in all; last exception - AMQPConnectorSocketConnectError: ConnectionRefusedError(111, 'Connection refused'); first exception - AMQPConnectorSocketConnectError: ConnectionRefusedError(111, 'Connection refused')."  path="/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pika/adapters/utils/connection_workflow.py:746" process="MainProcess" thread="Thread-7" trace_id=""
level=ERROR time=2025-01-08 04:58:58,449 msg="AMQPConnectionWorkflow - reporting failure: AMQPConnectionWorkflowFailed: 3 exceptions in all; last exception - AMQPConnectorSocketConnectError: ConnectionRefusedError(111, 'Connection refused'); first exception - AMQPConnectorSocketConnectError: ConnectionRefusedError(111, 'Connection refused')"  path="/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pika/adapters/utils/connection_workflow.py:723" process="MainProcess" thread="Thread-7" trace_id=""
level=ERROR time=2025-01-08 04:58:58,450 msg="Connection workflow failed: AMQPConnectionWorkflowFailed: 3 exceptions in all; last exception - AMQPConnectorSocketConnectError: ConnectionRefusedError(111, 'Connection refused'); first exception - AMQPConnectorSocketConnectError: ConnectionRefusedError(111, 'Connection refused')"  path="/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pika/adapters/blocking_connection.py:450" process="MainProcess" thread="Thread-7" trace_id=""```
Above logs are from `model-service` using `python ~/instabase/provisioner.py logs model-service -f`

Can someone help here?
cc: @Rakesh @Aayush
Here's the screenshot of all the services status.

For model service, I see that RABBIT_MQ_URL is set to host.docker.internal in your sandbox. Setting it to `rabbitmq` should fix it for you.

Also, now it's recommended to use a sandbox created from the ibdev-backend template where all of this is preconfigured and it's just a one click setup template!
